cyclone.name: BONNIE
cyclone.current_location: about 435 mi (695 km) SE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest, expected to slow and arc toward the Georgia-South Carolina coastline, then meander northeast just inland before re-emerging off the North Carolina coast during days 4-5
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south of Charleston, South Carolina (GA/SC border area)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River, GA, to Little River Inlet, SC (tropical storm warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Georgia, South Carolina and southeastern North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Outer rainbands could bring occasional gusts 20â€“30 mph, well below tropical-storm force at the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Palm Beach coastline from this system
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered squalls with brief heavy showers possible Saturday as the circulation passes to the northeast, but widespread heavy rainfall not expected
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf and dangerous rip currents along the southeast Florida coast
